text: Cat Bordhi (1951 - 2020) was a teacher, author, and knitting expert. She changed how people knit socks and scarves. She was very influential in the knitting community. She self-published books that opened up a very closed and tightly controlled knitting publishing industry. She also wrote a novel called Treasure Forest. It was a Nautilus Book Award winner in 2004. She was born 2 March 1951 in San Francisco, California. She died 19 September 2020 at home in Friday Harbor, Washington. She was 69 years old. ==References== Category:1951 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Textile artists Category:American novelists Category:Writers from San Francisco Category:20th-century artists Category:21st-century artists
title: Cat Bordhi
